keyword: how many calories in a red potato
title: How Many Calories in a Red Potato?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a red potato, including full nutrition breakdown per medium serving, macros, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Red Potato?
assumptions: Medium size (about 150g), baked with skin, no added fats, salt, or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato size, variety, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or scales for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A medium red potato provides ~135 kcal, 31g carbs, and 3.4g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a medium red potato?
faqs.a: About 135 kcal for one medium (150g) baked with skin.
No, one medium has ~31g carbs, but also 3.4g fiber for net carbs around 27.6g.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a red potato?
faqs.a: Roughly 3.3g protein per medium red potato.
Very lowâ€”only 0.2g total fat per medium potato, with 0g saturated.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in red potatoes?
faqs.a: Baking or boiling keeps calories low; frying or adding butter/oil increases them significantly.
